website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice if you are looking for a motion sensor for indoor use that's also intuitive.
pros: A compact device that doesn't require installation – wireless operation powered by the Philips Hue app
cons: Requires some tech-savvy to set up
Doesn't pick up motion if placed in tight spaces or behind walls/objects

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the hue family. It enables full automation to my lighting system. Response time can still improve though but it's far from a deal breaker. The only thing that needs more work is the Hue App. It currently allows user to set two scenes only : 1 for daytime and 1 for nighttime. I would love to see philips open it up more to allow users create more time setting profiles in corporation with the sensor. HomeKit integration should be added too! 4-Star now but if the above two pointers are implemented, then 5-Star!!
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: It can be made to work with Alexa, if you have the Hue hub
customer_reviews.text: This can be used as a trigger/sensor for Alexa routines. I like that has a 2032 (US quarter coin size) battery so the installation choice is simplified without needing power wiring. To do the Alexa sensing, you will need to have the Philips Hue Hub already. Since I already use Hue smart lights, I have the hub. Otherwise, it is just a dumb sensor to trigger the lights. With the interfacing to Alexa, the routines are more flexible and voice activated. No problems with range and sensitivity. I don't know how long the batteries last. When I get near, the hue lights turn on. I think the price is high. There may be cheaper solutions with google, samsung, ittt, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Stew

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I'm not poor with this.
customer_reviews.text: I rigged this up at the main entrance to my house, near a batch of windows. It was a breeze to rig it up to turn on lights when I walk in if it wasn't already naturally lit well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Not really HomeKit compatible
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and has a fast response time, in certain situations, namely it only works well with Hue lights. However it is a HomeKit certified motion sensor, and Phillips has artificially limited the product so it can't control other HomeKit devices. The entire point of HomeKit is to ensure compatibility between devices, so this is a disappointing decision on the part of Phillips that I sincerely hope they reconsider. It would do wonders for customer satisfaction and loyalty.
customer_reviews.author: American Pie

customer_reviews.title: Works well - slightly limited by software, as others have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: These combined with hue lights feel like the future. I have them set up to turn on blue-ish light in the morning when I wake up to stop my body's melatonin production, and then a warm nightlight if I need to get up in the middle of the night. Love them. Also really good sensitivity/coverage. Would definitely recommend. Only complaint is similar to others mentioned here: the software is a little limiting. I'd love the ability to create more than two sections of time that I can assign scenes/light settings to.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth

customer_reviews.title: Just set it up and forget about it!

Easy to set up. work as I expected it too. Right now it does nothing during daytime. And turns on at night time. Would buy more !

customer_reviews.title: Awesome

This sensor was deadly simple to setup - just pick the room and it will automatically create day and nighttime scenes. Also, it's smaller and works immediately. Highly recommend.

product_meta.title: Philips Hue Smart Motion Sensor (Installation-Free Exclusive for Philips Hue Lights), Hue Hub Required
product_meta.description: Automatically switches lights for your convenience Control your lights automatically by adding a Philips Hue motion sensor to your Philips Hue system. You can place the sensor anywhere in your home as it is battery powered and completely wireless. Simply walk by to trigger your lights
feature_bullets: Light up a room simply by walking in and control the intensity by the time of day, such as a gentle, warm nightlight to help you navigate your home at night.
Battery powered, wireless, and installation free, this Hue Motion Sensor requires the Hue hub (sold separately) to work, connecting to your Hue system with control via the Philips Hue App.
Place it anywhere in your home including your hallway, bathroom, kitchen, and more. The integrated light sensor saves energy by detecting when rooms are vacant and automatically turning off lights.
Make it part of your Hue home lighting system with Hue accessories (sold separately) such as the Hue Tap or Hue Motion Sensor. Control by voice with Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, and Google Assistant.
Connect it with your Nest or Samsung SmartThings system. Each kit includes one Hue Motion Sensor with two AAA alkaline batteries, a magnet, screws, a manual, and a two-year warranty.
